p: Finally, it should be noted that deintercalation of Ca ions from CaTaN 2 would require them to migrate in the space between the (TaN 2) 2– layers. The simplest pathway for Ca diffusion in the structure is the octahedral–tetrahedral–octahedral hopping mechanism in the Ca layer (see Figure 6 C). The large calculated energy barrier (1.7 eV) is indicative of a hampered Ca diffusion. Thus, it seems that other oxidation/decomposition reactions which may involve evolution of N 2 (as suggested by the decrease in N content from 10.5 to 7.7% revealed by EDX) are likely to occur instead or concomitant to deintercalation. These would most likely be related to the progressive amorphization observed upon oxidation.
